name: datacatalog
title: Cloud DataCatalog API
description:
DataCatalog APIs provides features to attach metadata to Google Cloud Platform resources like Bigquery Tables.
Key critical resources include -
- Entries (Datahub representation of a cloud resource)
- Tag Templates (Definition of columns and value types for attaching metadata)
- Tags (Values associated with Tag templates and attached to Entries.)
Datahub also provides rich search functionality to search resources for Entries and tags.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl.description: View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services

name.description:
Output only. The resource name of the crawler. Must be empty when creating
a crawler. For example, "projects/a/crawlers/b".

displayName.description: Required. The display name of the crawler.

config.description: Required. The configuration of the crawler.

bucketScope.description:
Bucket scope. Directs the crawler to crawl specific buckets within the
project that owns the crawler.

projectScope.description:
Project scope. Directs the crawler to crawl the buckets of the project
that owns the crawler.

organizationScope.description:
Organization scope. Directs the crawler to crawl the buckets of the
projects in the organization that owns the crawler.

adHocRun.description: Ad-hoc option. User can choose this option for ad-hoc runs.

scheduledRun.description: Scheduled option. User can choose this option for scheduled runs.

bundleSpecs.description:
The bundling specifications. Directs the crawler to bundle files into
filesets based on the bundling specifications.

GoogleCloudDatacatalogV1alpha3BucketScop.description: Configuration to scope a crawler to the provided list of buckets.

buckets.description: The maximum number of buckets allowed is 1000.

bucket.description: The bucket name. For example, GCS bucket name.

GoogleCloudDatacatalogV1alpha3ParentProj.description: Configuration to scope a crawler to the parent project.

GoogleCloudDatacatalogV1alpha3ParentOrga.description: Configuration to scope a crawler to the parent Organization.

scheduledRunOption.description: Required. The scheduled run option of the crawler.

nextPageToken.description:
Token to retrieve the next page of results or empty if there are no
more results in the list.

GoogleCloudDatacatalogV1alpha3RunCrawler.description: Request to run a crawler manually.

name.description:
Output only. The name of the crawler run.
For example, "projects/project1/crawlers/crawler1/crawlerRuns/042423713e9a"

state.description: Output only. The state of the crawler run.
enumDescriptions: This crawler run is waiting on resources to be ready.

error.description:
Output only. The error status of the crawler run. This field will be
populated only if the crawler run state is FAILED.

Status.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different
programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by
[gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). The error model is designed to be:

- Simple to use and understand for most users
- Flexible enough to meet unexpected needs

# Overview

The `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message,
and error details. The error code should be an enum value of
google.rpc.Code, but it may accept additional error codes if needed.  The
error message should be a developer-facing English message that helps
developers *understand* and *resolve* the error. If a localized user-facing
error message is needed, put the localized message in the error details or
localize it in the client. The optional error details may contain arbitrary
information about the error. There is a predefined set of error detail types
in the package `google.rpc` that can be used for common error conditions.

# Language mapping

The `Status` message is the logical representation of the error model, but it
is not necessarily the actual wire format. When the `Status` message is
exposed in different client libraries and different wire protocols, it can be
mapped differently. For example, it will likely be mapped to some exceptions
in Java, but more likely mapped to some error codes in C.

# Other uses

The error model and the `Status` message can be used in a variety of
environments, either with or without APIs, to provide a
consistent developer experience across different environments.

Example uses of this error model include:

- Partial errors. If a service needs to return partial errors to the client,
    it may embed the `Status` in the normal response to indicate the partial
    errors.

- Workflow errors. A typical workflow has multiple steps. Each step may
    have a `Status` message for error reporting.

- Batch operations. If a client uses batch request and batch response, the
    `Status` message should be used directly inside batch response, one for
    each error sub-response.

- Asynchronous operations. If an API call embeds asynchronous operation
    results in its response, the status of those operations should be
    represented directly using the `Status` message.

- Logging. If some API errors are stored in logs, the message `Status` could
    be used directly after any stripping needed for security/privacy reasons.

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of google.rpc.Code.

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
google.rpc.Status.details field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

additionalProperties.description: Properties of the object. Contains field @type with type URL.

GoogleCloudDatacatalogV1alpha3ListCrawle.description: Response to listing the runs from a crawler.

crawlerRuns.description:
The crawler runs from this crawler, it includes both currently running and
completed runs.

nextPageToken.description:
Token to retrieve the next page of results or empty if there are no
more results in the list.

parent.description:
Required. The name of the project this crawler is in. Example:
"projects/foo".

crawlerId.description: Required. The id of the crawler to create.

create.description:
Creates a new crawler in a project. The request fails if the crawler
(`parent`, crawlerId) exists.

name.description:
Required. The resource name of the crawler. For example,
"projects/foo/crawlers/bar".

get.description: Gets a crawler in a project.

parent.description: Required. The parent resource name. Example: "projects/foo".

pageSize.description:
The maximum number of items to return. The default value for this field
is 10. The maximum value for this field is 1000.

pageToken.description: The next_page_token value returned from a previous list request, if any.

list.description: Lists the crawlers in a project.

name.description:
Output only. The resource name of the crawler. Must be empty when creating
a crawler. For example, "projects/a/crawlers/b".

updateMask.description: The update mask applies to the resource.

patch.description: Updates a crawler in a project.

name.description:
Required. The resource name of the crawler.
For example, "projects/bar/crawlers/foo".

delete.description:
Deletes a crawler in a project. The request fails if the crawler does
not exist.

name.description:
Required. Resource name of the crawler resource.
For example, "projects/project1/crawlers/crawler1".

run.description:
Runs a crawler will create and execute an ad-hoc crawler run.
The request fails if the crawler is already running.

name.description:
Required. Resource name of the crawler run to retrieve.
For example, "projects/project1/crawlers/crawler1/crawlerRuns/run1".

get.description: Gets a particular run of the crawler.

parent.description:
Required. Resource name of the parent crawler resource.
For example, "projects/project1/crawlers/crawler1".

pageSize.description:
The maximum number of items to return. The default value for this field
is 10. The maximum value for this field is 1000.

pageToken.description: The next_page_token value returned from a previous list request, if any.

list.description:
Lists crawler runs. This includes the currently running, pending and
completed crawler runs.
